{{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{other uses}}
[[File:PaodeAcucar.JPG|thumb|Sugarloaf Mountain]]
A '''Morro''' is a rocky outcrop in the shallow waters of a harbor, often round in shape and sometimes very high. They are commonly made from hard [[granite]] or [[quartz]].
Famous examples are the [[Fort San Felipe del Morro|San Felipe del Morro Castle]], located in San Juan, Puerto Rico, [[Sugarloaf Mountain, Brazil|Sugar Loaf]] in [[Rio de Janeiro]], [[Brazil]], Morro Solar in [[Lima]], [[Peru]] and [[Morro Rock]] in [[California]], [[USA]].
==See also== *[[Hill]]
